pullRequest.title: Use ProtoArray instead of BlockTree in Store
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR Description
Follow on to #3124 to move the ProtoArray inside Store, replacing the BlockTree which previously held block hashes and slots.
BlockMetadataStore interface is introduced so Store can use either ProtoArray or BlockTree for block hashes which allows a BlockTree backed Store to be used to migrate the ProtoArray data from snapshot based to being rebuilt from the hot block data (and thus always in sync with Store).  Once the migration is done, the BlockTree in Store is replaced with the ProtoArray to free up memory.
Fixed Issue(s)
#2832
Documentation

 I thought about documentation and added the documentation label to this PR if updates are required.

nodes.bodyText: Shouldn't we check that these were processed in order?

To make sure I understand, the deadlock would happen in the following way?:

We enter this method, run findHead and acquire the protoarray locks
Another transaction finishes, acquires store locks, and tries to acquire protoarray locks in BlockMetadataStore.applyUpdates, but can't
findHead now tries to acquire the store locks but can't
And ProtoArrayForkChoiceStrategy.onAttestation doesn't create a similar problem because it's only acquiring the votesLock?
Doesn't this only save the first epoch boundary seen as processing hashes on the chain instead of saving the latest one?
